segment.source: How to test a driver package
segment.target: How to test a driver package

segment.source: You can use Visual Studio to deploy and install a driver package on a test computer, and then verify that the driver is installed and running.
segment.target: You can use Visual Studio to deploy and install a driver package on a test computer, and then verify that the driver is installed and running.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: A driver package that is ready to install.
segment.target: A driver package that is ready to install.

segment.source: You must first create and build your driver and then create a driver package for installation.
segment.target: You must first create and build your driver and then create a driver package for installation.

segment.source: For more information, see Building a Driver and Creating a Driver Package.
segment.target: For more information, see Building a Driver and Creating a Driver Package.

segment.source: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions to Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1).
segment.target: If you have not already done so, follow the instructions to Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1).

segment.source: After you have configured and provisioned a test computer, you can use Visual Studio to deploy drivers, schedule tests, and debug drivers on the test computer.
segment.target: After you have configured and provisioned a test computer, you can use Visual Studio to deploy drivers, schedule tests, and debug drivers on the test computer.

segment.source: For information about deployment and about how you can deploy a driver automatically at build time, see Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer.
segment.target: For information about deployment and about how you can deploy a driver automatically at build time, see Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer.

segment.source: Instructions
segment.target: Instructions

segment.source: Step 1: To test the driver installation on a test computer
segment.target: Step 1: To test the driver installation on a test computer

segment.source: After you have configured and provisioned a test computer, you can configure the driver package project so that it is automatically deployed and installed on the test computer.
segment.target: After you have configured and provisioned a test computer, you can configure the driver package project so that it is automatically deployed and installed on the test computer.

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver project.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver project.

segment.source: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click Deployment.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click Deployment.

segment.source: Select the Enable deployment option.
segment.target: Select the Enable deployment option.

segment.source: For more information, see Deployment Properties for Driver Projects.
segment.target: For more information, see Deployment Properties for Driver Projects.

segment.source: Select the test computer you have configured as the Remote Computer.
segment.target: Select the test computer you have configured as the Remote Computer.

segment.source: Under Driver Installation Options, click Install and Verify, and then select the Default Driver Installation Task.
segment.target: Under Driver Installation Options, click Install and Verify, and then select the Default Driver Installation Task.

segment.target: Related topics
